citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s attending veterinarian can not provide veterinary care to the birds. Lack of oversight by an attending
veterinarian can negatively impact animal welfare if injuries, illnesses, and diseases are not treated under veterinary
guidance. The facility must have formal arrangements with an attending veterinarian that provides adequate veterinary
care to all of its animals. Correct by April 24, 2025.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male turkey was observed by APHIS with reddened swelling on the left side of its neck. This turkey’s respiratory rate
and effort were elevated, and the breathing was audible. The attending veterinarian had not been consulted about this
issue until the time of inspection. An increased respiratory rate and effort may be caused by a serious underlying
respiratory disease. The facility must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and the availability of emergency, weekend, and
holiday care under the guidance of an attending veterinarian. Correct by March 27, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility’s attending veterinarian can not provide veterinary care to the birds. Lack of oversight by an attending 
veterinarian can negatively impact animal welfare if injuries, illnesses, and diseases are not treated under veterinary 
guidance. The facility must have formal arrangements with an attending veterinarian that provides adequate veterinary 
care to all of its animals. Correct by April 24, 2025. 
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A male turkey was observed by APHIS with reddened swelling on the left side of its neck. This turkey’s respiratory rate 
and effort were elevated, and the breathing was audible. The attending veterinarian had not been consulted about this 
issue until the time of inspection. An increased respiratory rate and effort may be caused by a serious underlying 
respiratory disease. The facility must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of 
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and the availability of emergency, weekend, and 
holiday care under the guidance of an attending veterinarian. Correct by March 27, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
